name: ChangeAssemblyVersionsTask
description: Allows to change/add AssemblyVersion, AssemblyFileVersion and AssemblyInformationalVersion in AssemblyInfo.cs files using a custom shema or from the build-number.
author: Jens Hofmann

options.Custom: Provide a static version or use variables to define the version.
options.BuildNumber: Extract the version from the Buildnumber using a regular expression

inputs.name: assemblyInformationalVersionString
inputs.label: AssemblyInformationalVersion
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a static version or use variables to define the version. You can use the special variable $TfvcChangeset which is the Tfvc Changesetnumber.

inputs.name: assemblyInformationalVersionBuildNumberRegex
inputs.label: Buildnumber Version-Regex
inputs.helpMarkDown: This is the regex used to extract the version number from the build numer of the current build. The task will search for the named groups major, minor, build and revision. All groups are optional and will be replaced with 0 if they do not exist. Additionally there are 2 more groups: prefix and postfix, which both are optional. Matches of these groups will be put in the front or back of the version.

inputs.name: assemblyInformationalVersionPrefixString
inputs.label: Prefix
inputs.helpMarkDown: An optional string which is put in front of the matched version numbers but after an optionally matched prefix-regex-group. You can use the special variable $TfvcChangeset which is the Tfvc Changesetnumber.

inputs.name: assemblyInformationalVersionPostfixString
inputs.label: Postfix
inputs.helpMarkDown: An optional string which is put at the end of the matched version numbers but before an optionally matched postfix-regex-group. You can use the special variable $TfvcChangeset which is the Tfvc Changesetnumber.

options.Custom: Provide a static version or use variables to define the version.
options.BuildNumber: Extract the version from the Buildnumber using a regular expression

inputs.helpMarkDown: This is the regex used to extract the version number from the build numer of the current build. The task will search for the named groups major, minor, build and revision. All groups are optional and will be replaced with 0 if they do not exist.

inputs.name: searchDirectory
inputs.label: Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the directory in which to search for the filename

inputs.name: fileNamePattern
inputs.label: Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the *.cs file in which to search/update the attributes/versions

inputs.name: recursiveSearch
inputs.label: Recursive
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to do a recursive search for the file pattern

instanceNameFormat: Update versions in file '$(fileNamePattern)' of directory '$(searchDirectory)' - recursive: '$(recursiveSearch)'
